result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory Powell Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment, and after care. Must undergo anger management and cognitive intervention counseling. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment or attend school full time or a combination of both equal to full time. No contact, directly or indirectly, with the victims.   Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

Defendant does not plan on seeking postconviction relief.

Defendant Gregory  Powell in court with attorney Domingo S. Cruz.  Defendant Gregory  Powell in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Parties have reviewed PSI as well as jail incident reports; no additions or corrections noted by parties. The State is in Ch. 950 compliance.

BTC: 14CF1633,  Ct 1: Total sentence is 8 yrs WPS bifurcated as 4 yrs IC, 4 yrs ES/CFTS
                              Ct 2: Total sentence is 2 yrs WPS bifurcated as 1 yr IC, 1 yr ES-consec to Ct 1
                              Ct 3: Total sentence is 2 yrs WPS bifurcated as 1 yr IC, 1 yr ES-consec to Cts 1 & 2

          14CF1077, Ct 1: 6 mos RCJ, costs
                              Ct 3: 3 mos RCJ-consec to Ct 1 and prison sentences, costs
                              Ct 4: 6 mos RCJ-conc with Cts 1 & 3, costs 
                              Ct 5: 4 mos RCJ-conc with Cts 1, 3 & 4, costs
           time in 14CF1077 may be served in WPS

         15CM2255 is dismissed

Conditions:
obey all rules and regs
costs
DNA sample & costs
no alc/cs except by Rx-UA's
any counseling deemed approp by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care
must undergo anger management and cognitive intervention counseling
FT emp/school = FT
no contact, directly or indirectly, with victims

FAW/vote

NOT eligible for CIP or SAP

Defendant Gregory Powell in court with attorney Domingo S. Cruz.  Defendant Gregory Powell in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.

Def - Acknowledge receipt and waive reading of both Amended Infos
St - In 14CF1633 plea to Cts 1-3; DRI balance. In 14CF1077 plea to Cts 1, 3, 4 and 5; DRI Ct 2
Rights given
Pleas: 
14CF1077 - Cts 1 & 3 - Guilty, Ct 4 - No Contest, Ct 5 - Guilty
14CF1633 - Cts 1-3 - No Contest
BTC: Finding of guilt 14CF1633 Cts 1-3; DRI Cts 4-7. Finding of guilt 14CF1077 Cts 1, 3, 4 & 5; DRI Ct 2. PSI ordered. 
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Gregory Powell in court with attorney Domingo S. Cruz.  Defendant Gregory Powell in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Matter is resolved. Defense asks for COP  Plea hearing scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Gregory Powell in court with attorney Domingo S. Cruz.  Defendant Gregory Powell in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Mr. Cruz is newly appointed by SPD. Mr. Cruz has received part of prior counsel's file and it was incomplete. Mr. Cruz has additional information that must be reviewed. Defense asks for 30-45 days  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gregory Powell in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Gregory Powell in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Jane Slaght.
Parties have both submitted but from defense in 14CF1077 and from State in 14CF1633. The State indicates a matter has arisen that may affect the trial. Defense indicates that they have gone over file and has met with the State. Defense indicates that deft now wishes him to withdraw from the case. The Court conducts a colloquy with the defendant regarding his wish to have Mr. Hamad withdraw. The State indicates that the global offer that he extended to Mr. Hamad is now withdrawn and he will renegotiate with the new attorney

BTC: Mr. Hamad may withdraw. SPD to reappoint  Status conference scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gregory Powell in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Gregory Powell in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Atty Hamad would like to review new offer with defendant.
Defense req bond mod in 14CF1077.
BTC:  Mod bond to $2000.  All other conditions remain.
Status conference scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 09:30 am.
ADA Repischak files proposed and substantive jury instructions.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with victims', C.A and N.D, person, property, residence or family.    It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.    Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Gregory Powell in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Gregory Powell in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense motion for modification of bond.  Currently $50,000 cash.  Requesting $10,000 with GPS, house arrest. 
State opposed.  Bond as set is appropriate.
BTC:  Bond modified to $25,000 cash; same terms and conditions.
Bail/bond hearing on January 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on February 6, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.

Defendant Gregory Powell in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Gregory Powell in custody.  Gerad T Dougvillo and Robert Repischak for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.
Defense requests bond modification. State objects to bond modification. 
BTC: Bond modification is denied.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 6, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on December 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   No contact with the victim CA, ND (person, property, residence or family).   Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Gregory Powell in court with attorney Nhu Huong Tran.  Defendant Gregory Powell in custody.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
